page.title: 15NOTABLE EVENTS.
page.content: 1985 Sees the Quincentenary celebrations of the Battle of Bosworth,with the victory of King Henry 7th over King Richard 3rd. Market Bosworth and the surrounding villages are celebrating this battle in style. The Primary school initiated events in May with Maypole and Country-dancing in the Square in period costume.Celebrations continue throughout the summer-time with a musical festival, flower festivals and a Medieaval Banquet. Barlestone village has already celebrated its annual Gala with a procession of floats,following a band down the main street.Old bicycles rode alongside to the primary school and there were stalls and side-shows.Bosworth's celebrations come to an end with the annual Carnival in August.
